14.11. Friday

SUB-et Just Film

16:00 111201 - Hellion

1h 34' Solaris Kino

Hard-drinking Texas single dad Hollis (Aaron Paul) struggles to raise his two boys, including rebellious teenager Jacob (Josh Wiggins). Seething with anger, Jacob finds release in the high-risk, white-knuckle world of motocross—but his increasingly reckless behavior threatens to spin out of control.

2014, USA, 1h 34'

Kat Candler
Director

SUB-en SUB-et Just Film Goethe Institut presents: New German Cinema

16:00 111601 - Mission: Sputnik

1h 30' Coca-Cola Plaza

“Mission Sputnik” is the adventurous story about the “real” happenings of Nov 9, 1989 in Germany, the day the wall came down. For ten-year-old Frederike, Oct 89 gets off to a disastrous start: her beloved Uncle Mike (27) is leaving the GDR. Inspired by her big idol Captain Kirk, Frederike and her friends Jonathan (10) and Fabian (10) construct a teleporting device to “beam” herself to West Berlin to bring back her uncle Mike. But the experiment dramatically fails. Instead of beaming Uncle...

2013, Germany, Belgium, Czech Republic, 1h 30'

Markus Dietrich, Pavel Strnad
Director

SUB-en SUB-et Just Film

16:30 111701 - Behavior

1h 48' Coca-Cola Plaza

Eleven-year-old Chala lives alone with his mother and takes care of fighting dogs for a living. He feels a close connection to his sixth grade teacher Carmela who, after falling ill, is replaced by a new teacher who imposes a strict disciplinary regime in class. She sends Chala to a reeducation school, a decision Carmela vehemently opposes. The bond between teacher and student grows stronger as they confront a system determined to impose a rather orthodox method of teaching

2014, Cuba, 1h 48'

Ernesto Daranas
Director

SUB-en Focus on Polish Cinema. New Films

16:45 111501 - Nude Area

1h 15' Coca-Cola Plaza

Love doesn’t unfold like a story. Only the first and the last chapter are known. Love starts from Love and ends in Letting go. In between there is tenderness and cruelty, waiting and fulfillment, ecstasy and disappointment. If love is a discourse, these are her figures of speech. "Nude Area" presents an adolescent love between two girls, one Dutch, another one Moslem. Childish cruelty is mixed with full-blown sensuality. Dreams and life reflect and complete each other. The end is...

2014, Poland, Netherlands, 1h 15'

Urszula Antoniak
Director

SUB-et Just Film

17:00 111101 - The Inbetweeners 2

1h 36' Solaris Kino

Will, Jay, Neil and Simon head Down Under in this raunchy sequel to the record-breaking comedy. Last time we met the Rudge Park posse, they were causing chaos in Malia, Crete. Nearly a year on, Will (Simon Bird), Jay (James Buckley), Neil (Blake Harrison) and Simon (Joe Thomas) have gone their separate ways. Jay is staying with his uncle in Australia. Neil has actually managed to get a job. And Simon and Will are at different universities, but life isn't panning out as they'd hoped. So...

2014, UK, 1h 36'

Damon Beesley, Iain Morris
Director

SUB-en Forum

17:00 111801 - Test

1h 36' Coca-Cola Plaza

They live in the steppe. A father and a daughter. Nothing may disturb the eternal order. Tomorrow always comes. And every morning the father goes away to work. And she stays alone. To wait for her father. And to feel. Two men are in love with her. She loves everyone. Her love cannot be divided. One day, the decision comes by itself. It comes from where the sun lives.

2014, Russia, 1h 36'

Alexander Kott
Director

SUB-en 18 Selected Titles

17:00 111901 - Halfway

1h 56' Artis

Involved in a bitter divorce Stephen moves into a splendid house he managed to buy at a bargain. But his peace and quiet are soon disturbed when he finds Theo standing in his living room, soaked to the skin, claiming to be the rightful resident of the house and demanding Stephen to move out. Unwilling to yield, Stephen finds himself in the midst of a turf war and the harassments between both men soon get out of hand. Then Stephen discovers that Theo used to be the...

2014, Belgium, 1h 56'

Geoffrey Enthoven
Director

Special Programme: So Different, So Similar

17:00 111402 - Love is Strange

1h 34' Coca-Cola Plaza

After 39 years together, Ben (John Lithgow) and George (Alfred Molina) finally tie the knot in an idyllic wedding ceremony in lower Manhattan. But when news of their marriage reaches the Catholic school where George works, he is fired from his longtime job, and the couple can no longer afford their New York City apartment. As a temporary solution, George moves in with the two gay cops next door, while Ben moves to Brooklyn to live with his nephew, Eliot; Eliot’s wife, Kate; and their...

2014, USA, France, 1h 34'

Ira Sachs
Director

SUB-en Panorama

17:00 111301 - I'm Not Angry!

1h 50' Solaris Kino

Navid, an Iranian Kurd living in Tehran, meets Setareh during the protests that erupt following the 2009 elections. They continue their political activism at their university until one day Navid is thrown out. To cap it all, Setareh’s father tells him to stay away from his daughter; if Navid really loves her, so the argument goes, he will not ruin her future by continuing to woo her as a penniless man. Navid pleads for a period of grace in which he can find work and a place...

2014, Iran, 1h 50'

Reza Dormishian
Director

SUB-en SUB-et PÖFF's Vitamin Boost

17:00 112201 - Tokyo Fiancée

1h 40' Sõprus

Her head filled with dreams, Amélie, 20, goes back to Japan, where she spent her childhood. To earn a living, she decides to give privates classes in French and meets Rinri, her first and only student, a young Japanese man with whom she soon has an intimate relationship. Between surprises, happy times and the pitfalls of a culture shock that is both poetic and amusing, she discovers a side of Japan she had never seen before... “Writer-director Liberski applies a...

2014, Belgium, France, Canada, 1h 40'

Stefan Liberski
Director

SUB-en Forum

17:15 112001 - August Winds

1h 17' Artis

Shirley, a gorgeous young woman, has left the big city to live in the countryside and take care of her elderly grandmother. The life with her boyfriend Jeison slides slowly in the small seaside town. One day, a corpse washes ashore. The film is set in a beautiful fishing village in Brazil’s north eastern state of Alagoas, exceptionally depicted through well-composed images. The strong sense of place and the stunning cinematography gather with the touching performance of the main couple...

2014, Brazil, 1h 17'

Gabriel Mascaro
Director

SUB-et Just Film

18:00 111602 - 52 Tuesdays

1h 49' Coca-Cola Plaza

16-year-old Billie’s reluctant path to independence is accelerated when her mother reveals plans for gender transition and their time together becomes limited to Tuesday afternoons. Filmed over the course of a year, once a week, every week – only on Tuesdays – these unique filmmaking rules bring a rare authenticity to this emotionally charged story of desire, responsibility and transformation.

2013, Australia, 1h 49'

Sophie Hyde
Director

Just Film

18:00 111202 - The Art of Flight 3D

1h 20' Solaris Kino

A new breed of action sports film comes to life as Red Bull Media House, in association with Brain Farm Digital Cinema, present "The Art of FLIGHT," a Curt Morgan film. Equal parts action and adventure mix with the inevitable drama encountered along the way. Two years in the making, "The Art of FLIGHT" gives iconic snowboarder Travis Rice and friends the opportunity to redefine what is possible in the mountains. Experience the highs, as new tricks are landed and new zones opened, alongside...

2011, USA, 1h 20'

Curt Morgan
Director

SUB-en Opening Film

18:00 112801 - City of Ruins

0h 5' Nordea Kontserdimaja

Before the official opening screening will be shown short film “City of Ruins” (dir: Damian Nenow) which is simulation of the flight of a Liberator plane over the destroyed Warsaw of 1945.

2010, Poland, 0h 5'

SUB-en SUB-et Opening Film Focus on Polish Cinema. New Films

18:15 112802 - Warsaw 44

1h 55' Nordea Kontserdimaja

Summer 1944. Warsaw, Poland, is occupied by the Nazis. After the death of his father, Stefan works at a chocolate factory to support his mother and brother. Humiliated by the Nazis every day, Stefan wants to join the anti-Nazi resistance but he can’t because he promised her mother not to engage in any military activity. At last, he plans a revolt with his friends, while also falling in love with a girl. “Warsaw 44” is based on an actual revolt that happened on August 1, 1944 in...

2014, Poland, 1h 55'

Jan Komasa
Director

Guests: Józef Pawłowski (actor), Jan Kwiecinski (producer)

SUB-en Panorama

18:30 The State - Mafia Pact

1h 48' Coca-Cola Plaza

What do we mean when we talk about “The State-Mafia Pact”? About the concessions given on behalf of the State to the Mafia in exchange for an end to bloodshed? Who exactly is culpable for the assassination of Falcone and Borsellino? What do we know about the endless coexistence of Mafia and Politics? Between the Mafia and the Catholic Church? Between the Mafia and the Police? Or is there more? A group of actors bring to life the most relevant episodes of the sequence of events known as...

2014, Italy, 1h 48'

Sabina Guzzanti
Director

SUB-en Panorama

18:30 111502 - Güeros

1h 48' Coca-Cola Plaza

It is 1999 in Mexico City. Sombra and Santos live in a strange limbo since the UNAM strike broke out. Strikers against the strike stick at home: no school, no money, just devising strange ways for killing time. In the other side of the country, a water bomb thrown from a high block explodes in a baby stroller. Result: the out-of-control teenager Tomas is sent to the city, to visit his older brother Sombra. Tomas discovers that his hero, Epigmenio Cruz, a legendary rock singer of the 60’s,...

2014, Mexico, 1h 48'

Alonso Ruiz Palacios
Director

SUB-et Just Film

18:45 111702 - Four Corners

1h 54' Coca-Cola Plaza

Four lives will change forever as the destinies of a reformed prison ‘general,’ a local cop, a charismatic gang leader and a surgeon back from London intersect with a young boy’s coming of age in in a tale of family lost and family regained in the unknown world of South Africa’s Cape Flats.

2013, South Africa, 1h 54'

Ian Gabriel
Director

SUB-et SUB-ru Just Film Special Screenings

19:00 111401 - Trash

sold out 1h 53' Coca-Cola Plaza

Stephen Daldry (perhaps best known for “Billy Elliot”) directs and Richard Curtis scripts in this intriguing blend of Hollywood genre and foreign art-house. Running the gamut of influences – from “City of God” (whose director, Fernando Meirelles, is involved via his company 02 Filmes) to “Slumdog Millionaire” – the film is a surprising and refreshing piece of work. The film begins with corrupt Rip police killing a man in order to get their hand on his wallet that contains important...

2014, UK, 1h 53'

Stephen Daldry
Director

SUB-en SUB-et PÖFF's Vitamin Boost

19:00 112202 - Paris of the North

1h 38' Sõprus

Seeking shelter from the trials and tribulations of city life, Hugi has built a quiet existence for himself in a tiny village in the middle of nowhere. Here, he passes his days jogging, attending AA meetings and taking Portuguese lessons online. But when Hugi’s estranged, boozy father shows up out of the blue, the precarious balance he has worked so hard to achieve is tested to the limit.

2014, Iceland, France, Denmark, 1h 38'

Hafsteinn Gunnar Sigurdsson
Director

SUB-en 18 Selected Titles

1h 48' Artis

The story takes place nowadays, in a small and poor village in Bulgaria, which is located close to the border with Turkey and Greece. Mityo (45) lives with his son Vasko (18). The relations between the two of them are strained after the recent death of Fanka – Mityo’s wife and mother of Vasko. The situation is getting even worse – the dairy, where Mityo has worked for 15 years, went bankrupt. He remains unemployed and he can’t cover the payments on the loan, which...

2014, Bulgaria, 1h 48'

Stephan Komandarev
Director

Just Film

19:00 111102 - It Follows

1h 37' Solaris Kino

For 19-year-­old Jay (Maika Monroe), the fall should be about school, boys and weekends at the lake. Yet after a seemingly innocent sexual encounter she suddenly finds herself plagued by nightmarish visions; she can't shake the sensation that someone, or something, is following her. As the threat closes in, Jay and her friends must somehow escape the horrors that are only a few steps behind. With a riveting central performance from Monroe and a strikingly ominous electronic score by...

2014, USA, 1h 37'

David Robert Mitchell
Director

SUB-en SUB-et Doc@POFF

19:15 111902 - The Green Prince

1h 39' Artis

“If somebody raped his mother, that’s very shameful. But if you collaborated with Israel, that’s much more shameful.” The young Mosab once believed the words and actions of his father Scheikh Hassan Yousef, one of the founders of the radical Islamist organisation Hamas, a group that still terrorises Israel today. His family and many Palestinians now consider Mosab an evil traitor. As a teenager sitting in an Israeli prison after being sentenced for unauthorised possession of a gun, Mosab...

2014, Germany, UK, USA, Israel, 1h 39'

Nadav Schirman
Director

Doc@POFF

19:15 111802 - Monsoon

1h 48' Coca-Cola Plaza

We know the veteran filmmaker Sturla Gunnarsson for winning the notable People’s Choice Award at Toronto International Film Festival, for his previous documentary “Force of Nature: The David Suzuki Movie” in 2010, but also for his long career in television and feature films. In his newest documentary, capturing this, what is called the soul of India, Sturla has created a stunning meditation of the heaviest rains on planet Earth – the “Monsoon”. In India, Monsoon, is the taker and the...

2014, Canada, 1h 48'

Sturla Gunnarsson
Director

SUB-en Screen International Critic's Choice

19:15 111302 - Tales

1h 28' Solaris Kino

Arthouse melodrama “Tales” (Ghesseha) sees experienced Iranian director Rakhshan Banietemad mining characters from her previous films to create a mosaic of downtrodden lives in contemporary Teheran. It’s refreshing to see themes such as domestic abuse, drug addiction and workers’ rights being aired so openly and honestly in an Iranian film. But although characters from different narrative strands meet and overlap, and though you don’t need to be familiar with the director’s oeuvre to...

2014, Iran, 1h 28'

Rakhshan Bani-Etemad
Director

SUB-et Just Film 18 Selected Titles

19:45 111203 - Starred Up

1h 46' Solaris Kino

Scottish director David Mackenzie has made a career of creating complex and slightly surreal films with the likes of “Young Adam”, “Hallam Foe” and (his Hollywood debut) “Spread” all under his belt. But his latest film is perhaps his most uncompromising and grittily realistic work to date. Eric is a young offender moved to an adult jail (which is known as being ‘Starred Up’). His violent nature brings him into conflict with both the prison authorities and the various factions of...

2013, UK, 1h 46'

David Mackenzie
Director

SUB-en Panorama Focus on hot topics

20:15 111603 - Letter to the King

1h 15' Coca-Cola Plaza

“Letter to the King” portrays five persons' meeting with Norway outside the refugee camp. They are given permission to leave the snowy no mans land and travel to Oslo, a welcome change in an otherwise monotonous life. But we soon realise that all of them have a purpose with this trip. All five will be confronted by their destinies as they discover happiness, suffer humiliation, find love and seek revenge. The five stories are bound together by a letter, written by eighty-three year...

2014, Norway, Iraq, 1h 15'

Hisham Zaman
Director

SUB-en Forum

21:00 111303 - At Home

1h 43' Solaris Kino

Up in a spacious house on the hills of Marathon. A beautiful view of the Aegean Sea. This is where Nadja lives. Along with Stefanos, Evi and their daughter Iris. The four of them are close. They are family. Or so it seems. This is also where Nadja works. She is cleaning, cooking, nursing. Nadja is the familyʼs housemaid. She has been with them since the child spoke her first word. She has been there for Evi when she lost her second child. But in the wake of the countryʼs...

2014, Germany, Greece, 1h 43'

Athanasios Karanikolas
Director

Doc@POFF

21:00 112203 - Jodorowsky's Dune

1h 30' Sõprus

Legendary Chilean filmmaker Alejandro Jodorowsky wanted to make a film about one of the most known sci-fi novels out there, the 1965 epic “Dune” by Frank Herbert. That, what is the world’s best selling science fiction novel, was years in preparation to become one of the greatest sci-fi films ever made. Jodorowsky would gather “spiritual warriors” around him and thus discovered the great artists like Dan O’Bannon, Swiss surrealist H.R. Giger and French graphic artist Jean “Moebius” Girard....

2013, USA, 1h 30'

Frank Pavich
Director

Doc@POFF

21:00 111703 - Visitors

1h 27' Coca-Cola Plaza

Thirty years after “Koyaanisqatsi”, Godfrey Reggio – with the support of Philip Glass and Jon Kane – once again leapfrogs over earth-bound filmmakers and creates another stunning, wordless portrait of modern life. Presented by Steven Soderbergh in Black and White digital 4K projection, “Visitors” reveals humanity’s trancelike relationship with technology, which, when commandeered by extreme emotional states, produces massive effects far beyond the human species. The film is visceral,...

2013, USA, 1h 27'

Godfrey Reggio
Director

SUB-en Focus on Polish Cinema. New Films

21:15 112003 - Field of Dogs

1h 36' Artis

Father ploughs a supermarket with oxen, the plough ripping the tiles. A forest full of dead and Niagara falling onto a cathedral altar. These are the visions of Adam, a poet who had lost his beloved in a car crash. A national tragedy imposes on a personal one. It is 2010, a Biblical year for Poland with floods, fires, landslides and the catastrophe of the presidential plane being torn apart in mysterious circumstances along with the nations elite. Adam gives up his job as professor of...

2014, Poland, 1h 36'

Lech Majewski
Director

SUB-et SUB-ru Screen International Critic's Choice

21:15 111103 - Boyhood

2h 45' Solaris Kino

Not just a coming-of-age movie, but the definitive coming-of-age movie, Richard Linklater’s 12-years-in-the-making “Boyhood” follows the travails of a young Texas boy and his family. Filmed sequentially in pieces every year from 2002–2013, the film observes its young actors Ellar Coltrane and Lorelei Linklater mature through the years, from wide-eyed children to awkward adolescents. “Boyhood” begins as Mason (Coltrane) and his older sister Samantha (Linklater) are in primary school,...

2013, USA, 2h 45'

Richard Linklater
Director

SUB-en SUB-et SUB-ru 18 Selected Titles

21:30 111403 - Turist (Force majeure)

sold out 2h 0' Coca-Cola Plaza

A Swedish family travels to the French Alps to enjoy a few days of skiing. The sun is shining and the slopes are spectacular but, during a lunch at a mountainside restaurant, an avalanche turns everything upside down. With diners fleeing in all directions, mother Ebba calls for her husband Tomas as she tries to protect their children. Tomas, meanwhile, is running for his life… The anticipated disaster failed to occur, and yet the family's world has been shaken to its core, a question mark...

2014, Sweden, France, Denmark, Norway, 2h 0'

Ruben Östlund
Director

21:30 111803 - Blind Massage

1h 54' Coca-Cola Plaza

One director, part of the Chinese new wave cinema, Ye Lou, almost like a mission, brings stories and characters to the screen that can be easily considered a part of the outcast. So it is also in his latest film “Blind Massage” where the main characters are blind masseuses and the heart of the film is a small oasis in the middle of busy Nanjing – the Sha Zhong Massage Center. The blind friends (Wang Zhihua) and Sha (Qin Hao) partner together running this center, where all the workers...

2014, China, France, 1h 54'

Ye Lou
Director

SUB-et SUB-ru PÖFF's Vitamin Boost

21:45 111903 - The Young and Prodigious T.S. Spivet

1h 45' Artis

T. S. Spivet (Kyle Catlett) lives with his parents, sister Gracie and brother Layton in a remote ranch in Montana. A little boy with a gift and a passion for science, he invents the machine of perpetual movement, which earns him the highly prestigious Baird Award from the Smithsonian Museum in Washington. After leaving a note to his family, he sets out alone to pick up the award, crossing the United States on a freight train. But no one in Washington ever imagined that the lucky winner...

2013, France, Canada, 1h 45'

Jean-Pierre Jeunet
Director

SUB-en SUB-et PÖFF's Vitamin Boost

22:00 111204 - Wild Tales

sold out 2h 2' Solaris Kino

Inequality, injustice and the demands of the world where we live is the reason why many people suffer from stress or depression. Some explode. This is a film about them. The heroes of “Wild Takes”, vulnerable to an abruptly changing and therefore unpredictable reality, give in to the undeniable pleasure of losing control. Behind this enigmatic synopsis hides one of the craziest and most politically incorrect comedies that you have ever seen. The film is organized in five different...

2014, Argentina, Spain, 2h 2'

Damián Szifron
Director

2h 7' Coca-Cola Plaza

Alice dreams of the dress in the Japanese series Magical Girl Yukiko. Luis, her father, will do anything he can to make his ailing daughter’s dream come true. By chance, he meets Barbara, a pretty girl with a psychological disorder and some ‘special’ tendencies. Damián, Barbara’s old teacher that just leaves the prison, will try to help her. 2014, Spain, 2h 7'

Carlos Vermut
Director

15.11. Saturday

SUB-et Just Film

12:00 121301 - Lola on the Pea

1h 30' Solaris Kino

Good things come to those who wait. Lola lives with her mom Loretta on a houseboat. Since her father vanished into thin air a year ago, she has become introverted and lives in her own little dream world. She has vowed not to cut her hair or wash the spot on her neck where her dad last kissed her until he gets back. She doesn't really get along with her classmates at school, and her only real friend is the crazy old captain Solmsen. One day, however, while hanging out at her favorite spot...

2014, Germany, 1h 30'

Thomas Heinemann
Director

Film is dubbed in Estonian

SUB-et Just Film

1h 20' Coca-Cola Plaza

When the two best friends, Jill and Joy find a huge amount of money on the street on the first day of the summer holiday they decide to buy a house from mysterious Mrs. Rosebud. It is a real dream house, measured and equipped exactly for two little seven-year-old girls’ requirements. Jill and Joy start to live the summer of their dreams, which is full of adventure and surprises but without any parents. Saara Cantell
Director

Film is dubbed in Estonian

SUB-et Just Film

12:30 121201 - A Christmoose Story

1h 21' Solaris Kino

When his father cannot make it home Max is convinced that Christmas will be extremely boring this year. But then Mr. Moose crashes through his roof and he is not so sure anymore. This is a giant talking Moose with a big mouth, a warm hearth and a tendency for drama. He claims he was on a test-run with Santa Claus, lost control over the sleigh and crashed, injuring his leg. And now he has to find Santa Claus, otherwise nobody will receive their Christmas gifts. Is Max able to get Mr. Moose...

2013, Netherlands, 1h 21'

Lourens Blok
Director

SUB-et Just Film

13:45 121702 - The Incredible Machine

1h 20' Coca-Cola Plaza

Nine-year-old Tibor has only one friend: his outdated house robot T.I.M. When his father trades his robot in for a newer version Tibor manages to save his friend from dismantlement and undertakes an epic journey to the only person who can repair T.I.M: the mythical robot maker Hector Sammler. But on this voyage through an unknown world T.I.M. slowly but surely falls apart and the question arises if they will ever find Hector Sammler if he even exists at all...

2014, Netherlands, Denmark, 1h 20'

Rolf van Eijk
Director

SUB-et Just Film

14:00 121302 - Songs for Alexis

1h 15' Solaris Kino

Songs for Alexis is a classic coming of age love story about two passionate teenagers stuck in American suburbia. 18-year-old Ryan is a talented musician and transgender, and began his transition from girl to boy 4 years earlier. He is wildly in love with the beautiful and enigmatic 16-year-old Alexis, but her parents' disapproval of Ryan forces her to choose between her family and an unsafe future with the man she loves.

2014, USA, Denmark, 1h 15'

Elvira Lind
Director

SUB-en Panorama

14:00 121901 - White Shadow

1h 57' Artis

Since 2008, albinos in Tanzania have become human targets. Witch doctors offer huge sums of cash for their body parts to be used in magic potions. From 2008 to 2010, more than 200 witch doctor inspired murders occurred. As a local saying goes: “Albinos do not die, they just disappear.” This is the story of Alias, an albino boy on the run. After his father’s murder, his mother sends him to the city. His uncle Kosmos, a truck driver, takes care of him. Alias learns fast in the city,...

2013, Tanzania, Germany, Italy, 1h 57'

Noaz Deshe
Director

SUB-en SUB-et Just Film

14:15 121202 - Beyond Beyond

1h 18' Solaris Kino

Johan and his father have lived at sea for as long as Johan can remember. Or at least since he was three and his mother disappeared. Johan likes the ship. It has a greenhouse where they grow carrots, and it has fishing nets. Johan is good at diving and at mechanics, and helps his father repair the ship. One day when Johan’s father goes for provisions and Johan is left alone on the boat, he receives a distress call on the radio with a clue about his mother’s whereabouts...

2014, Sweden, Denmark, 1h 18'

Esben Toft Jacobsen
Director

Film is dubbed in Estonian

SUB-et Just Film

14:30 121601 - Rhubarb

1h 10' Coca-Cola Plaza

Winnie and Siem (12) meet when their parents, Rik and Tosca, fall in love at the playground of their school. They quickly form a ‘patchwork family’. Siem is pretty used to this already as his father, Rik, has been through two marriages already. Siem and Winnie get on really well together and are looking forward to the upcoming wedding between their parents. But when irritations and bickering start to take over between Rik and Tosca, the kids' faith in a new happy family takes its first...

2014, Netherlands, 1h 10'

Mark de Cloe
Director

SUB-et SUB-ru Panorama

15:00 122201 - '71

1h 39' Sõprus

A tense and exciting action-drama about a young British soldier caught out of his depth on the mean streets of Belfast in Northern Ireland in the early years of the Troubles, the impressively mounted "’71" is a remarkably assured feature debut for Yann Demange. In England in 1971 new recruit Gary Hook and his fellow squaddies find themselves sent to Northern Ireland. The city is divided between Protestant Loyalist area and the Catholic Nationalist areas. When the soldiers find themselves...

2014, UK, 1h 39'

Yann Demange
Director

SUB-en 18 Selected Titles

15:00 121801 - The Postman's White Nights

sold out 1h 30' Coca-Cola Plaza

Separated from the outside world with only a boat to connect their remote village to the mainland, the inhabitants of Kenozero Lake live the way their ancestors did for centuries gone by: the community is small, everyone knows each other and they produce only those things which are necessary for survival. The village Postman (Aleksey Tryaptisyn) is their sole connection to the outside world, relying on his motorboat to bridge the two civilizations. But when his boat’s motor is stolen...

With Fabian on their tail, the duo’s perilous journey alternates between safety and terror. Veteran director Diego Lerman, working in a mode of delicate realism, sensitively limns the social and emotional plight of a mother and child upended by harrowing domestic circumstances.

2014, France, Argentina, Colombia, Poland, Germany, 1h 35'

Diego Lerman
Director

SUB-et Just Film

1h 51' Solaris Kino

Eve (Emily Browning) is a catastrophe—low on self-esteem but high on fantasy, especially when it comes to music. Over the course of one Glasgow summer, she meets two similarly rootless souls: posh Cass (Hannah Murray) and fastidious James (Olly Alexander), and together they decide there's only one thing to do: form a pop group.

SUB-en Panorama

20:30 142003 - A Wolf at the Door

1h 40' Artis

Set in the suburbs of Rio de Janeiro, “A Wolf at the Door” is the nerve-rattling tale of a kidnapped child and the terror of the parents left behind. When Sylvia (Fabíula Nascimento) discovers her six-year-old daughter has been picked up at school by an unknown woman, police summon her husband Bernardo (Milhem Cortaz) to the station for questioning. 1h 39' Artis

Two facets of Ethiopian society, the tradition of forced marriage and justice, fight it out in court.

22:30 182004 - Brooklyn

1h 23' Artis

1h 1' Artis

A documentary can also be animated. In the animated documentaries special programme the topics portrayed are those that are not easy to catch on camera or that are not easily discussed in front of the camera: openly about homosexuality, abortion through the female psychology, war through visual metaphors or life with Asperger’s syndrome.

Animated Dreams

15:00 202201 - Rocks in my pockets

1h 29' Sõprus

A personal story of animator Signe Baumane about the women in her family, including herself, and their battles with madness. Defying the stigma that silences so many, Signe takes us on a journey deep into her own depression where she looks to confront the family demons. SUB-en SUB-et Goethe Institut presents: New German Cinema

19:00 201903 - Home from Home: Chronicle of a Vision

3h 45' Artis

“Home From Home” by Edgar Reitz opened in cinemas in 2013 and won the German Film Prize in 2014. The film is the latest in Reitz’s “Heimat” (Homeland) epic, which started with a TV mini-series in 1984. With this prequel to the saga, Reitz returns to his main topic, the migration of German peasants from Hunsrück to South America. Hunger, poverty and chance force people in the middle of the 19th century to migrate from the fictional village of Schabbach to an uncertain future in Brazil....

2014, Germany, France, 3h 45'

Ilmar Raag
Director

SUB-en SUB-et Focus on Polish Cinema: G Like Generations PÖFF Lifetime Achievement Award - Maja Komorowska

18:45 211602 - Family Life

1h 28' Coca-Cola Plaza

Featuring three of Poland’s greatest actors, this intense chamber piece centers on an ambitious young industrial designer who is summoned home to help his alcoholic father and suicidal sister. Both the aristocratic family he fled in shame and scorn, and their dilapidated country estate, bathed in an oppressively nostalgic light, prove ultimately inescapable. A neatly dismissive coda wraps up this taut, supremely well-made example of formal Polish film-making.

1970, Poland, 1h 28'

SUB-en SUB-et Focus on Polish Cinema: G Like Generations PÖFF Lifetime Achievement Award - Maja Komorowska

16:30 221701 - Man of Iron

2h 33' Coca-Cola Plaza

In Warsaw in 1980, the Party sends Winkel, a weak, alcoholic TV hack, to Gdansk to dig up dirt on the shipyard strikers, particularly on Maciek Tomczyk, an articulate worker whose father was killed in the December 1970 protests. Posing as sympathetic, Winkel interviews people who know Tomczyk, including his detained wife, Agnieszka. Their narrations become flashbacks using actual news footage of 1968 and 1970 protests and of the later birth of free unions and Solidarity.

1981, Poland, 2h 33'

22:30 221204 - A Pigeon Sat on a Branch Reflecting on Existence

sold out 1h 41' Solaris Kino

The final part of Swedish auteur Roy Andersson’s “Living” trilogy is a magnificently droll, compassionate, melancholic reflection on the absurd human comedy. Cast in the director’s by now familiar fixed-camera style, with a washed-out colour palette that runs the gamut of beiges, greys and pale greens and blues, the film presents 39 meticulously composed tableaux vivants that range from simply observed moments of life to elaborate dreamlike fantasies with dozens of extras in period dress....

2h 10' Coca-Cola Plaza

“Maidan” chronicles a civil uprising against the regime of president Yanukovych which took place in Kiev (Ukraine) in the winter of 2013/14. 1h 45' Artis

When war forces the evacuation of villagers out of a mountainous region in Azerbaijan, the formidable aging Nabat, faithfully tied to her family and her land, refuses to leave. Persevering in a deserted village, her resolve is tested through progressively dire circumstances. 17:15 252001 - Home from Home: Chronicle of a Vision

3h 45' Artis

“Home From Home” by Edgar Reitz opened in cinemas in 2013 and won the German Film Prize in 2014. The film is the latest in Reitz’s “Heimat” (Homeland) epic, which started with a TV mini-series in 1984. With this prequel to the saga, Reitz returns to his main topic, the migration of German peasants from Hunsrück to South America. Hunger, poverty and chance force people in the middle of the 19th century to migrate from the fictional village of Schabbach to an uncertain future in Brazil....

SUB-en SUB-et Focus on Polish Cinema: G Like Generations PÖFF Lifetime Achievement Award - Maja Komorowska

16:00 261601 - Family Life

1h 28' Coca-Cola Plaza

Featuring three of Poland’s greatest actors, this intense chamber piece centers on an ambitious young industrial designer who is summoned home to help his alcoholic father and suicidal sister. Both the aristocratic family he fled in shame and scorn, and their dilapidated country estate, bathed in an oppressively nostalgic light, prove ultimately inescapable. A neatly dismissive coda wraps up this taut, supremely well-made example of formal Polish film-making.

1970, Poland, 1h 28'

SUB-et SUB-ru Screen International Critic's Choice

16:00 271101 - Birdman

sold out 1h 59' Solaris Kino

A magnificent and enthralling film that fits into no easy genre bracket, “Birdman” is a technical tour de force, a beautifully performed and smartly scripted black comedy that will leave its audience keen to head back for more, perhaps just to work out how Alejandro González Iñárritu staged some of the film’s more striking moments. Plus it finally offers the talented Michael Keaton a role that really shows off his range and charisma and one that should see him in contention when it comes...

In his newest documentary, capturing this, what is called the soul of India, Sturla has created a stunning meditation of the heaviest rains on planet Earth – the “Monsoon”. Sturla Gunnarsson

SUB-en Doc@POFF EOK Presents

16:30 271701 - Next Goal Wins

sold out 1h 37' Coca-Cola Plaza

When American Samoan national soccer team suffered the world’s worst defeat, losing to Australia 31-0, these tiny islands crash-landed into last place in the FIFA world rankings, and became known as “the worst team in the world.” Despite having not won an official match for more than a decade, the team is held together by their pure love of soccer, deep faith, and American Samoan pride. “Next Goal Wins” delivers an intimate view of their miraculous efforts as they train for the next World...

2014, UK, 1h 37'

Mike Brett, Steve Jamison

A black sea black comedy with socio-political commentary.

Director

SUB-en Panorama

18:30 271903 - The Fool

1h 56' Artis

Dima Nikitin is a simple and honest plumber who works in a small Russian town. Except for his unusual integrity, nothing makes him stand out of the crowd, until one night in a dorm mainly occupied by drunkards and outcasts, the pipes burst, endangering the occupants. Everybody needs to be immediately evacuated but nobody cares, so Nikitin sets off on a night-long odyssey to fight an entire system of corrupt bureaucrats.

Yuriy Bykov

Fourteen-year-old Maria is a typical teenage girl except that, since her family are devoted Christians, her heart belongs first and foremost to God. The girl wants to do what is right according to her religion, but she’s constantly surrounded by various temptations and seductions. The drama, which observes the role of religion in a person’s life, shows Maria’s life in 14 scenes, matching the fourteen Stations of the Cross on Jesus’s path to Mount Kolkata. The debut feature of artist filmmakers Iain Forsyth and Jane Pollard, this take on the rock documentary straddles the line between fiction and reality as it examines in the life of rock icon Nick Cave as works on his 2013 album Push the Sky Away. Set during a (fictionalised) 24 hour period in the life of the lead singer of the Bad Seeds, the film sees Cave reflect on his work, the nature of art and the religious nature of musical performance. SUB-en Forum Focus on hot topics

19:15 272003 - Nabat

1h 45' Artis

When war forces the evacuation of villagers out of a mountainous region in Azerbaijan, the formidable aging Nabat, faithfully tied to her family and her land, refuses to leave. Persevering in a deserted village, her resolve is tested through progressively dire circumstances. With breathtaking cinematography, unfolding in long, masterful tracking shots, the stunning “Nabat” is a sublimely moving testament to the enduring power of one woman – and of a country – surviving against all odds....

2014, Azerbaijan, 1h 45'

Elchin Musaoglu

He and his estranged wife, Lu Xiaojuan, desperately look all over the country, and finally find their son in a small Anhui village in 2012. The pop idol is preparing a world tour, and by the statue’s erection lots of tourist will come, business...

SUB-en Panorama

21:00 272203 - Black Coal, Thin Ice

1h 46' Sõprus

In 1999 a gruesome killing and mutilation takes place in a small town in northern China. A worker from a coal plant has been murdered, and the severed parts of his body are found in various locations across the province, hundreds of kilometers apart. The police investigation soon uncovers multiple suspects, but the attempt to bring them in for questioning takes a heavy toll; two police officers are killed and one is wounded. The officer that was wounded, Zhang Zili, is forced to retire...

When their 8000 year-old flatmate Petyr, turns 20-something human hipster Nick, into a vampire, the guys must teach him the ropes and guide him through his new found eternal life.
